Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Dontre Hamilton was shot 14 times for simply resting on a park bench, when in reality he was shot after striking an officer with a baton.
Understate: The claim understates the actions of Dontre Hamilton by portraying him as simply resting on a park bench, when in fact he had struck an officer with a baton.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the statement that Dontre Hamilton was shot 14 times for resting on a park bench.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that Dontre Hamilton was shot solely for resting on a park bench, without considering the actions that led to the shooting.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that Dontre Hamilton was shot after striking an officer with a baton, rather than solely for resting on a park bench.
